questions.prompt: Who is the first person you harmed through your addiction?
questions.help: Be thorough and honest as you create your list.

questions.prompt: What harm did you cause this person?
questions.help: Be specific about your actions and their impact.

questions.prompt: How do you feel about making amends to this person?
questions.help: Consider your willingness and any fears.

questions.prompt: Who else did you harm? List another person.
questions.help: Continue building your comprehensive list.

questions.prompt: What harm did you cause them?
questions.help: Be specific and honest.

questions.prompt: List another person you harmed.
questions.help: Don't leave anyone out, including yourself.

questions.prompt: What harm did you cause them?
questions.help: Include emotional, financial, and other harms.

questions.prompt: Who on your list are you most afraid to face?
questions.help: Fear is common but doesn't have to stop you.

questions.prompt: What are you afraid will happen if you make amends to this person?
questions.help: Name your specific fears.

questions.prompt: Who on your list do you feel justified in having harmed?
questions.help: Be honest about any resentments or justifications.

questions.prompt: Can you see your part in that situation, regardless of what they did?
questions.help: Focus on your own behavior, not theirs.

questions.prompt: Have you included yourself on your amends list?
questions.help: We often harm ourselves most through addiction.

questions.prompt: How have you harmed yourself through your addiction?
questions.help: Consider physical, emotional, and spiritual harm.

questions.prompt: What amends do you owe yourself?
questions.help: Self-care and self-forgiveness are part of recovery.

questions.prompt: Is your amends list complete?
questions.help: Review your Fourth Step inventory for anyone you missed.

questions.prompt: Who on your list are you not yet willing to make amends to?
questions.help: Willingness, not action, is the requirement for Step Eight.

questions.prompt: What do you need to do to become willing to make amends to everyone?
questions.help: Prayer, time, or discussion with your sponsor may help.

questions.prompt: How has making this list affected you?
questions.help: Reflect on your feelings and insights.

questions.prompt: Are you willing to make amends to all persons you have harmed?
questions.help: This is the essence of Step Eight.

questions.prompt: Are you ready to begin Step Nine?
questions.help: Discuss your readiness with your sponsor.
